Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for refugee status after overstaying visa
Crimes.Application_Facts: Iranian martial arts athlete defected during competition in Canada, claimed fear of imprisonment and torture upon return
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Refugee status or protection under IRPA
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Applicant did not qualify as a Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Defected and remained in Canada beyond authorized stay
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to defection
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant and consistency with country conditions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to inconsistencies and lack of evidence
Crimes.Application_Basis: Claim of potential imprisonment and torture upon return to Iran
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentary evidence
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Recognition as Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Individuals who create their own persecution by violating laws of general application are not protected
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of corroboration and inconsistent statements
Crimes.Outcome: Refugee claim rejected; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division, Federal Court on review
Crimes.Cause_Description: Defection from Iran during international competition
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and plausibility of claims
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support claim of persecution
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to comply with visa conditions
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not found; issue was credibility of fear claim
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Canadian immigration authorities to assess refugee claims
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility based on internal inconsistencies
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Defection alone does not constitute persecution; applicant violated exit laws
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of supporting documentation and implausible testimony
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution under the Convention

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unauthorized entry or stay related to defection
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for Convention refugee status following immigration violation
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant defected from Iran during martial arts competition in Canada, claimed fear of punishment upon return
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Recognition as Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Applicant ineligible for protection as he faced legal consequences, not persecution
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Voluntarily remained in Canada after competition without authorization
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of imprisonment and torture due to defection
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA sections 96 and 97
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility, consistency with known country conditions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review of administrative decision
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Boardâ€™s findings
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Deemed not credible due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Application_Basis: Claim that returning would result in persecution
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Violation of exit visa laws does not equate to persecution
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of prosecution for illegal departure, not persecution
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board evaluated plausibility and coherence of narrative
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on lawful entry and stay
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to provide sufficient proof of individualized risk
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Not central; focus was on credibility of fear claim
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Canadian jurisdiction over refugee claims made at port of entry or within territory
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative assessment due to lack of corroboration
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Applicant created own predicament by violating Iranian law
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Weak evidence base and inconsistent testimony
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Convention refugee definition requiring well-founded fear of persecution
